results.title: And the lighthouse made three
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A plasticene animated film about a lonely lighthouse, a craggy old lighthouse keeper and a mysterious dark figure that moves in the fog. A delightful song ends this tale of unrequited love.
results.description: A plasticene animated film about a lonely lighthouse, a craggy old lighthouse keeper and a mysterious dark figure that moves in the fog. A delightful song ends this tale of unrequited love.

results.title: Amelia Rose Towers
results.creator_credit: Jackie Farkas, Nicole Sorby, AFTRS and Ashley Scarlett
results.brief_description: If, as a child, you were picked last for a team. And sought as your refuge a wish or a dream. If you ever felt lonely, peculiar or blue, then Amelia Rose Towers is a bit like you! True! Amelia Rose Towers ‘ whose initials spell ART ‘ faces off against an adversary whose initials spell MAN, after passing through surrealist chambers and screens offering images of a personal identity that can never be reconciled. A story of juggling variables of reality of self and other ; of space, time and perceptions; of the art of science and the science of art but it is also a story of hope, love and courage.

results.title: On perspective and motion
results.brief_description: “Using the signature gridwork of alleyways of Melbourne city as a device to explore alternative representations of scale and space, this time-lapse portrait of Melbourne explores the traffic flows; human, vehicular and meterological. One of the main aims of my artistic research is to explore new ways of perceiving the world we inhabit. By using machines to work outside of ‘realtime’ I hope to expose new modes of perception and uncover new forms of spatio/temporal representation. To this end I have developed systems for the control and manipulation of both spatial and temporal ‘camera’ positioning. Accurate and repeatable motion control combined with non linear frame capture and sophisticated digital post production provide the freedom to explore alternative visual representations of space/time, isolating and exaggerating the interwoven physical variables that construct perspective and motion.” Daniel Crooks, 2004

results.title: Love Della
results.brief_description: This is a 50’s home movie style portrait of a fictional 19 year old, undiscovered jazz starlet, called Della Ray ( Kate Cebrano).Though recently shot, the film masquerades convincingly as found footage of a 50’s jazz club and its inhabitants. It begins with a roller coaster jam session featuring unknown local musicians of 1958, and ends with an impromptu number by the delightful Delia herself, who “died” in the tradition of the jazz greats, shortly after the footage was shot. Features excellent original 50’s jazz numbers.

results.title: America
results.brief_description: Phoebe, Spencer, Felix and Mike have reached a point in their lives where they can no longer call Australia home. Is this due to the fact that they work at All American Videos, where ‘too much is never enough’? It is in this video store that they devise a plan to rob a bank by combining several of their favourite films and create the perfect crime to escape out of their quarter acre black future.
